file_content.text: Surprised to find me here, Sith? Don't be.
That was a nice trick you played back there, but there's no room for passion in a Jedi's heart.
I simply indulged your game until I was better prepared to face you. You will not claim that vile artifact.
Better me than some other Sith.
I'm not so bad.
Better no Sith at all.
You're a coward and a liar.
You disgust me.
I would not mistake caution for cowardice, Sith. I was not the one who came with manipulation and deception.
I can't believe Lady Rist hasn't killed you yet.
You betrayed Rehanna twice.
Rehanna is a smart woman. And out of the influence of your forked tongue, she was open to reason.
When you manipulate people's emotions toward your own ends, you only prove the Jedi philosophy.
The Jedi are elevated by higher things than emotion--by peace and justice.
You want to kill me for peace?
That's ridiculous!
Yes. If that artifact ends up in Sith hands, there will be no peace.
Shut up. [Attack]
Not all emotions are bad. Try love sometime.
Your view is too simple.
It is not for a Jedi to love and let his thoughts be clouded, weighted down by matter and emotion.
If you will not relent, then my Padawans and I are forced to kill you.
I've come this far.
I cannot relent.
You've been itching for action this whole time. Here it is.
Ready, Andronikos?
Do you have to ask?
Khem Val, what is it you do again?
Meet my dashade.
I will devour this Jedi with pleasure, my master.
You have no idea who you're dealing with.
That's a mistake.
Spare me your arrogance.
You've made your choice.
Death it is, then.
The darkness cannot hope to stand against the armies of the light.
Nomar. I'm surprised you came.
Despite what you must think of me, Rehanna, I try to be a man of my word.
Now you said you wanted a favor. What can I do for you?
You can do this, Rehanna.
Go on.
Nomar, I--
You can marry her like you promised.
Fulfill your vow.
I'm the one who wants the favor.
Forget her.
What's this Sith doing here? Rehanna, you tricked me.
No, Nomar. I didn't trick you. I called you here because we need to talk.
Then answer my question. What is this Sith doing here?
I just want to see you and Rehanna happy.
I'm a servant to love.
You want to see us happy. Heh.
I'm here for the key to Organa's vault.
You have something I need.
I should strike you down where you stand.
No, Nomar. Don't. If it hadn't been for this Sith, I would never have had the courage to call you.
Listen, Rehanna. You've been deceived.
The dark side leeches off of the light like a foul disease. It's time someone cut this cancer out.
Nomar! Will you stop being a Jedi and listen to me just once!
If he wants a fight, he'll get it.
It's okay.
Hear what she has to say.
Please, Nomar.
I love you, Nomar. I've never stopped. And I've spent the last twenty-three years waiting for you to get some sense into that thick skull of yours.
Rehanna, I--I don't know what you're talking about.
She loves you, idiot.
Are you that dumb?
You were engaged a while back. Remember?
I think you do.
Stay out of this, Sith.
No, Nomar. She's right.
No, Nomar. He's right.
We got engaged against everyone's wishes, and you ended it and what's worse--I still love you.
Rehanna, I don't know what you expect me to say. I'm a Jedi.
Tell her you love her.
You know what to say.
Don't play dumb, Nomar.
I'm getting tired of this.
Neither of you realize what it would mean. There is no room for passion in the light side--in the life of a Jedi.
Maybe you need to stop being a Jedi.
You're on the wrong path.
Stop being a Jedi? I couldn't....
Do you love her or don't you?
Search your feelings.
Love her? I haven't seen her in twenty--but what am I saying?
At least take the time to think about it.
Don't rule it out so fast.
You think I didn't? Run all the options through in my mind?
I don't see what's stopping you.
Why not?
I committed my life to this path. I can't just go back on my word.
I don't know--maybe I was foolish to think that we could ever forget. I'm so sorry, Rehanna.
I have more light than you'll ever have, and I love.
Light or dark is irrelevant.
It's--it's true. The oppressive weight of the dark side doesn't accompany you. Yet you're Sith. I don't understand.
You've been lying to yourself all this time, Jedi. You cannot deny your passion.
It's too late for you.
Please, Nomar. I understand that you thought you were doing what was right for us.
But all we've done is waste twenty years.
Perhaps you are right. Perhaps I do still care for you.
But what of that? Twenty years! The time is long past for us, and I have a duty to perform.
This may be your last chance at happiness.
Duty can wait.
Don't deny your feelings, Nomar.
Please, look at her.
Listen to her, Nomar.
Listen to him, Nomar.
It's not too late. We can start again. We can make up the time we lost.
Do you really think so? I'm sorry, Rehanna.
Shh. Just promise you won't leave me again.
I--want to--I can't make that promise. Not yet. Let's see how the Jedi Order reacts.
Now hand over the key to the Organa vault.
Finally.
I should have figured there was an ulterior motive.
Nomar, isn't it the least we can do to show our gratitude?
You're right, Rehanna.
Can I expect an invitation to the momentous event?
So when's the wedding?
I think maybe we'll take this one step at a time, right, Nomar?
I guess I should give you guys your space.
I'll be leaving now.
I don't really understand it, why you helped us like this. I feel like I should thank you, repay you in some way.
It's not much, but this key belongs to my family's vault in the Elysium. I understand there's something a Sith would value there.
I vowed to protect it from the Sith--but you're like no Sith I've ever met. And as I am no longer a Jedi, I am released from my vow.
Your happiness is all the thanks I need, but I won't refuse.
You're too kind.
Thank you.
At least you know special when you see it.
I am indeed one of a kind.
Now if you'll excuse us, we have twenty years of catching up to do.
Jedi and nobility are two kinds of folks I just don't understand.
It is unlike a Jedi to be so kind to a Sith. Be wary, my master.
You can do your duty by dying.
Then I must kill you.
You test my patience with your whining.
Shut up already.
No. You're asking too much.
I've devoted my life to serving the Jedi, and it's foolish to think that I'd give that up because some Sith comes along.
Say you'll marry her!
You know what to say. [Shock.]
Aaaarrrgh!
What are you--I can't believe--!
Stop playing dumb or I'll kill you.
Do you want to die?
I'll shut him up real easy.
I can make him listen.
Short answer? To kill you.
I want you dead.
Listen, Rehanna. This Sith tricked you into luring me here and now it's clear that she intends to kill me.
Listen, Rehanna. This Sith tricked you into luring me here and now it's clear that he intends to kill me.
No! You said you were going to help me, you said--
Sith trade in selfishness and manipulation. It's every Jedi's duty to oppose them.
Nomar, I only brought her here because I thought she could help.
Clearly, she had something different in mind.
Nomar, I only brought him here because I thought he could help.
Clearly, he had something different in mind.
Draw your lightsaber, Sith, if you even have courage to face me now that your manipulations have failed.
Courage isn't a problem.
Can't we talk about this?
Big mistake.
Just die already.
Clever trick, Sith. Getting Rehanna to call me down here like it was some sort of emergency.
Unfortunately for you, word travels fast on Alderaan. News of Rehanna's death greeted me at the spaceport, so I brought backup.
But you came anyway.
At least you're here.
She had outlasted her usefulness.
Your Rehanna is dead.
By your measure, yes. But you trade in selfishness and murder equally.
But frankly, I'm insulted. Where's Rehanna? You've gone to no effort to disguise your trap.
You came, and that's all I need.
What's it matter?
We Jedi will wipe the foul blight of the dark side from the galaxy and restore order wherever the Sith would sow chaos.
Funny, I thought you'd object to me using your girl as bait.
You're awfully detached.
Rehanna Rist is an innocent in this matter.
I see the trap you have laid out for me, but I do not care.
Give me the key to Organa's vault.
Work with me.
I know what you want, Sith. It's the very object my family has sworn to protect.
I cannot permit that vile artifact to fall into Sith hands. Unlike you, I am a person of principle.
What do you know of this "vile" artifact?
Vile?
The stories of Tulak Hord are vague and ephemeral, but this much I know.
Wherever he went, he left a trail of bodies, seemingly drained of their life, in his wake.
Sounds like just my kind of guy.
Excellent.
I leave a trail of bodies behind me anyway.
So?
I once blew the yoke out of an egg. Does that count?
That's a pretty neat trick.
I don't find you amusing in the slightest, Sith.
Enough of this talk. The time for judgment has come.
Your principles don't include keeping promises.
But not of your word.
I don't know what you mean by that, and I don't frankly care.
Then you die. [Attack]
The light will prevail, Sith, even against darkness as black as yours.
I have no business with you.
